isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Injection control pressure

svcprocinfo.para: To determine if the ICP system is providing sufficient hydraulic pressure to operate the injectors.

item.para: Electronic Service Tool (EST) with Master Diagnostics software
International® EZ-Tech Interface Cable

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the foreword of this manual. Follow all warnings, cautions, and notes.

note.para: Do this test at full load along with Test 14 (Boost Pressure) and 15 (Fuel Pressure - Full Load).

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: See Appendix A in this manual for specifications, and record on Performance Diagnostics form.
Open Road Performance.ssn, to monitor engine operation.
Monitor ICP.
Record ICP for low idle on diagnostics form.
Run engine at high idle, and record on diagnostics form.

item.para: If ICP is high or unstable for low or high idle conditions, do Step 6.
If ICP is in spec for high or low idle conditions, continue with Step 8.

step1.para: Run engine at high idle for 2 minutes.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following when taking oil sample:

item.para: When routing oil line , do not run the line too close to moving parts.
Do not let the line touch hot engine surfaces.
Use caution not to burn hands.

step1.para: Return to low idle, take oil sample and check for foam.

item.para: If oil is aerated, foam build-up will be seen on top of the oil. Correct condition.
If oil is not aerated, disconnect ICP sensor and check for engine stability. If problem is corrected, see Operational Voltage Checks in Section 7.
If ICP is still high or unstable, replace IPR and retest.

step1.para: Drive vehicle and make sure engine operating temperature reaches 70°C (158° F).
Find a long, open stretch of road.
Select a suitable gear, press accelerator pedal fully to the floor, and accelerate to rated speed at 100% load.
Record EST reading on diagnostics form.

item.para: If ICP is to spec, do not continue.
If ICP is not to spec, and oil is not aerated disconnect ICP sensor and retest. If problem is corrected, see Operational Voltage Checks in Section 7.
If ICP is still unstable, replace IPR following procedures in the Engine Service Manual and retest
Defective IPR valve,
Defective high pressure pump,
ICP system leakage
The ECM commands the IPR valve to reduce ICP caused by low boost pressure, an incorrect feedback signal from APS, or an incorrect feedback signal from the ICP sensor.

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring ICP using Pressure Sensor Breakout Harness

item.para: Pressure sensor breakout harness
DMM

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: See Appendix A in this manual for specifications, and record on Performance Diagnostics form.
Remove engine harness connector from ICP sensor.

figure.caption: Pressure sensor breakout harness installed - ICP

step1.para: Install pressure sensor breakout harness to ICP sensor and engine harness.
Use DMM to measure ICP at all conditions.

item.para: Connect POS to green (signal circuit) and NEG to black (ground circuit).

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:

When routing DMM leads, do not crimp the leads, run the leads too close to moving parts, or let the leads touch hot engine surfaces. Secure the DMM and leads in the cab so as not to obstruct the operator.

step1.para: Run DMM leads into cab.
Record ICP for low idle on diagnostics form.
Run engine for high idle and record on diagnostics form.

item.para: If ICP is high or unstable for low or high idle conditions, do Step 8.
If ICP is in spec for high or low idle conditions, continue with Step 10.

step1.para: Run engine at high idle for 2 minutes.

item.para: When routing oil line , do not run the line too close to moving parts.
Do not let the line touch hot engine surfaces.
Use caution not to burn hands.

Find a long, open stretch of road.
Select a suitable gear, press accelerator pedal fully to the floor, and accelerate to rated speed at 100% load.
Record DMM voltage reading on diagnostics form.
